intro: Mesembryanthemum ivori, commonly known as the Ivory Flower, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptive features for arid environments. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are thick and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum ivori is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
